str2: Then, at that time. From ho and hote; the when, i.e. At the time that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To turn back, return. From hupo and strepho; to turn under, i.e. To return.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Of Hebrew origin; Hierusalem, the capitol of Palestine.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
A mountain, hill. Probably from an obsolete oro; a mountain: -hill, mount(-ain).

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Genitive Neuter Singular
str2: (a) I call, summon, invite, (b) I call, name. Akin to the base of keleuo; to 'call'.
Olive-grove, Olive-yard, the mount Olivet. From elaia; an olive-orchard, i.e. the Mount of Olives.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Neuter Singular
Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Near. From a primary verb agcho; near.
Of Hebrew origin; Hierusalem, the capitol of Palestine.
A way, road, journey, path. Apparently a primary word; a road; by implication, a progress; figuratively, a mode or means.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Neuter Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
